channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CBS becomes Bari Weiss’ ‘anti-woke’ arena as the millennial media mogul (and mainstream media critic) digs in
item.description: The network where Walter Cronkite and Dan Rather became news icons is under new management.

item.title: How Zohran Mamdani Came to Embrace the Palestinian Cause
item.description: As Mr. Mamdani seeks to reassure New York City he is open to compromise, his views on Israel and Palestinians have been the biggest exception.

item.title: Justices Appear Open to Challenge of Mail-In Ballot Rules by Illinois Politician
item.description: A majority of the court appeared sympathetic to the argument that political candidates should be able to sue over their states’ election laws. The cas...

item.title: IRS to furlough almost half its workforce under contingency plan for government shutdown
item.description: Last week Trump said roughly 750,000 federal workers nationwide were expected to be furloughed across agencies, with some potentially fired.

item.title: Some Ford employees say they’ve been warned they could be fired for not going back to the office, report says
item.description: The automaker has tightened its return-to-office policy, requiring most salaried staff to work on-site four days a week as part of CEO Jim Farley’s br...

item.title: 29-year-old charged with starting the fire that destroyed LA’s Pacific Palisades
item.description: The complaint said the suspect, Jonathan Rinderknecht, asking a question to ChatGPT about lighting a cigarette in an effort to cover his tracks.

item.title: Stephen Miller Cited ‘Plenary Authority,’ Then Paused. Conspiracies Started Flying.
item.description: Online skeptics wondered if Mr. Miller had caught himself saying something he did not mean to. CNN says there was a technical glitch.

item.title: Cuomo Calls for Rebuilding Rikers Island and Keeping the Complex Open
item.description: Former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo wants to ditch New York City’s plan to replace the Rikers Island jail complex and use the sites for the proposed borough-b...

item.title: Jonathan Rinderknecht Arrested in Connection With Palisades Fire in Los Angeles
item.description: Officials say that Jonathan Rinderknecht, 29, of Melbourne, Fla., had intentionally set a fire that rekindled a week later into a devastating blaze th...

item.title: Billionaire PC tycoon Michael Dell is riding the AI gold rush—and he says the party’s far from over even if eventually ‘there’ll be too many’ data centers
item.description: Dell Technologies’ stock is up 39% year-to-date.

item.title: Israel Intercepts Another Activist Flotilla Aiming to Break Gaza Blockade
item.description: It was the second attempt in as many weeks to breach the restrictions around the Gaza Strip. Neither has succeeded.

item.title: A.I. Slop Is Here
item.description: A conversation with our tech columnist Kevin Roose about an A.I.-generated video of him on a date with a robot.

item.title: Another African Charity Tied to Prince Harry Faces Criticism
item.description: A charity tied to the British royal confirmed that the government of Chad has cut ties with the group, after allegations of mismanagement.

item.title: 4 Workers Die in Collapse at Hotel Site in Madrid
item.description: The authorities initially thought the workers might be trapped after the collapse on Tuesday, but their bodies were recovered from the rubble overnigh...

item.title: Macron Will Name New Prime Minister Rather Than Call Elections
item.description: The announcement from the French president came after last-ditch talks held by Sébastien Lecornu, France’s departing prime minister, who said most par...
